summary: This document is an email chain between Assistant U.S. Attorneys discussing the status of a grand jury investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. The emails mention scheduling issues for the grand jury, specifically that if an indictment is not secured by April 1, 2008, it would be delayed until April 15 due to a lack of quorum on April 8. The chain also includes personal notes about an attorney's recovery from knee surgery.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the grand jury investigation being discussed by the Assistant U.S. Attorneys.

connections.description: MI is being informed about the status of the grand jury investigation into Epstein.

events.title: Potential Indictment Deadline
events.description: A potential deadline for the grand jury to indict Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Grand Jury No Quorum
events.description: The grand jury investigating Epstein is noted as not having a quorum on this date.

events.title: Next Grand Jury Date
events.description: If no indictment is secured by April 1, the next opportunity for the grand jury to convene is on this date.

keyFacts: The document reveals internal DOJ communication about the timing of a potential grand jury indictment of Jeffrey Epstein in March/April 2008.
It indicates a specific scheduling pressure: an indictment needed to be secured by April 1, 2008, or it would be delayed until April 15 due to a lack of grand jury quorum on April 8.
The correspondence is between Assistant U.S. Attorneys, showing the operational planning within the prosecution team.
The subject line 'Any word on Epstein?' suggests ongoing inquiries or updates about Epstein's case status among the attorneys.
